SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.esri.mo2.data.feat
Interface Field

All Superinterfaces:
Cloneable
All Known Implementing Classes:
BaseField
public interface Field
extends Cloneable

Implements a Field and its supporting methods.

A Field is the definition of one column in a Table. The properties that define a Field include a name, an integer type which corresponds with the type values defined within java.sql.Types, and an optional display-size and precision which can be used to display a value.

Support for a FeatureClass's shapefield is provided by a standard default name for the shapefield, as well as a standard default static Field value that is within the BaseField class.

Various "predicates" are defined, which exemplify the mapping between java.sql.Types and the Java types that are described within Section 8.6 of the JDBC Guide found in the JDK v1.1 release docs.

See Also:
Table, Types

Method Detail

getName

public String getName()
Returns the name of the Field.

Returns:
the Field name

getInternalName

public String getInternalName()
Returns the Dataset-specific internal name for the Field. This internal name will usually be the same as Name. SDE, for instance has a "long name" that uniquely identifies a column in the database.

Returns:
the internal Field name

getType

public int getType()
Returns the type of the Field, as a JDBC SQL type.

Returns:
the JDBC SQL type

Returns:
the display size

getPrecision

Returns the (optional) precision of the Field, assuming that the field type is either a Double or Float.

Returns:
the precision

clone

public Object clone()
Overrides:
clone in class Object

cloneData

public Object cloneData(Object data)
Creates a clone of the specified data which is assumed to be of the type defined by this Field. This was needed because most basic data types such as Integer and Double do not have a clone.

Parameters:
data - the data to be cloned
Returns:
the cloned data
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if the data is not of correct type
See Also:
clone(), Row.clone()

equals

public boolean equals(Field f)
Checks the given Field for equality by comparing its properties to the current Field.

Parameters:
f - the Field to be compared for equality
Returns:
a boolean value - True if fields are equal, else False

format

public String format(Object val)
Formats the given value that corresponds with the current Field's type, into a String that is appropriate for the current locale. If any conversion errors occurs, they are trapped, and a blank string is returned instead.

Parameters:
val - the value to be formatted
Returns:
the formatted string

format

public String format(Object val,
                     Locale locale)
Formats a value for the specified locale.

Parameters:
val - the vslue to formatted
locale - the required Locale
Returns:
the formatted string

parse

public Object parse(String val)
Parses and converts a String to an appropriate object depending on the current Field's type. If any conversion errors occur, they are trapped, and a default value is returned instead. This should be performed for the current default locale, but for version 3.0, it is always performed using US English locale.

Parameters:
val - the string to be parsed
Returns:
the parsed value as an object

parse

public Object parse(String val,
                    Locale locale)
Parses a String in the specified locale.

Parameters:
val - the value to parse
locale - the required Locale
Returns:
the parsed object

parseNoDefault

public Object parseNoDefault(String val,
                             Locale locale)
                      throws Exception
Similar to the other parse methods, but does not return a default value if any conversion error occurs. Instead, an exception will be thrown.

Parameters:
val - the value to be parsed
locale - the locale
Returns:
the resulting object
Throws:
Exception - if any conversion errors occurs
See Also:
parse(String,java.util.Locale)

defaultValue

public Object defaultValue()
Returns a default value for the parse method in case a parsing exception occured.

isShape

public boolean isShape()
Determines if the Field type is a ESRI SHAPE type.

Returns:
True, if the type is a ESRI SHAPE, else False

public boolean isObject()
Determines if the Field type is equivalent to a Java Object.

True, if the SQL type is equivalent to Java Object, else False

isComparable

public boolean isComparable()
Determines if the Field type is "comparable", that is, the object values (produced by parse()) of this type implement java.lang.Comparable.

See Also:
Comparable, parse(java.lang.String)

isNumeric

public boolean isNumeric()
Determines if the field type is a numeric type.

Returns:
True, if the field is a BigDecimal, Integer, Double, Float, etc., else False
